alert.note: Alert for Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 29 at 4:18AM EDT until September 29 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM EDT THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 7 to 11 feet expected in the surf zone. For the Beach Hazards Statement, a high risk of rip currents is expected. * WHERE...In North Carolina, Eastern Currituck County. In Virginia, Virginia Beach. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, from 7 PM this evening to 6 AM EDT Saturday. For the Beach Hazards Statement, from 8 AM EDT this morning through this evening. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Breaking waves of 4 to 7 feet will result in rough surf conditions and a high risk of rip currents today. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Waves continue to build into Friday. A second round of high surf conditions is expected early next week. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. SEWELLS POINT VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.5 FT, MODERATE 5.5 FT, MAJOR 6.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.7 FT, MODERATE 2.7 FT, MAJOR 3.7 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 29/12 AM 3.1 0.3 0.4 2-3 NONE 29/12 PM 4.2 1.4 1.0 4 NONE 30/12 AM 3.9 1.1 1.3 4-5 NONE 30/01 PM 5.1 2.3 1.9 5 MINOR 01/01 AM 4.8 2.0 2.3 5 MINOR CHESAPEAKE BAY BRIDGE TUNNEL VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 5.0 FT, MODERATE 5.5 FT, MAJOR 6.0 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.1 FT, MODERATE 2.6 FT, MAJOR 3.1 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 28/11 PM 3.0 0.1 0.1 2-3 NONE 29/11 AM 4.1 1.2 0.6 4 NONE 29/11 PM 3.8 0.9 1.0 4-5 NONE 30/12 PM 5.0 2.1 1.5 5-6 MINOR 01/12 AM 4.4 1.5 1.7 6 NONE LYNNHAVEN INLET VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.5 FT, MODERATE 5.0 FT, MAJOR 5.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.8 FT, MODERATE 2.3 FT, MAJOR 2.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 28/11 PM 3.1 0.4 0.6 1 NONE 29/12 PM 4.2 1.5 1.2 1 NONE 30/12 AM 4.1 1.4 1.7 1 NONE 30/01 PM 5.3 2.6 2.3 1 MODERATE 01/01 AM 4.7 2.0 2.4 1 MINOR COROLLA NC MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 5.5 FT, MODERATE 6.0 FT, MAJOR 6.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.8 FT, MODERATE 2.3 FT, MAJOR 2.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 28/10 PM 3.8 0.1 0.3 2-3 NONE 29/10 AM 5.3 1.6 1.0 5-6 NONE 29/11 PM 4.7 1.0 1.3 7 NONE 30/11 AM 5.8 2.1 1.5 8-9 MINOR 01/12 AM 4.9 1.2 1.7 9-10 NONE 01/12 PM 5.5 1.8 1.3 7-8 MINOR &&
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.
